image.altText: A child is given oxygen during medical treatment.

props.synopsis: A boy is left badly burned after an unsafe child care incident. His parents rush him to hospital to save his finger. It should have never happened.

title.children: Boy left badly burned, blistered and bloody after shocking incident at child care

image.altText: Paramedics attend to a man on stretcher after attack, man onscured and lights flashing

props.synopsis: A Tongan national is on the run after an early morning border force operation saw one official assaulted and another stabbed in the neck.

title.children: Breaking: Manhunt after Australian Border Force workers stabbed, assaulted

image.altText: An image of Erin Patterson.

props.synopsis: Erin Patterson faces three charges of murder in the Latrobe Valley Law Courts. She's accused of killing three relatives by serving them beef Wellington containing poisonous mushrooms. Follow the trial in our live blog.

title.children: Evidence continues in Erin Patterson's mushroom murder trial

liveBlogKeyEvents.title: What happened at the trial yesterday?

image.altText: Anthony Albanese with two fists in the air.

props.synopsis: Anthony Albanese has credited his thumping election win to what he calls "progressive patriotism". Follow live.

title.children: Two-word slogan PM credits for election landslide

image.altText: Donald Trump pumping one closed fist in the air at the top of the stairs to Air Force One.

props.synopsis: Donald Trump's visit to the Middle East is certainly sending shockwaves across the region, as the president outlines his vision for relations between the United States and Arab states.

title.children: Cybertrucks and a snub: 5 key moments from Trump's day in the Middle East

image.altText: People looking inside the interior of a medium-sized vehicle at a car dealership.

props.synopsis: The headline numbers show another strong year of electric vehicle sales, but the growth is highly concentrated in China and emerging markets in South-East Asia and Latin America.

title.children: Chinese demand pushes global EV sales to new highs in 2024

image.altText: Residential housing in Gladstone in central Queensland

props.synopsis: Lenders are cutting fixed and variable rates in an attempt to attract customers ahead of a widely anticipated Reserve Bank meeting next week, when the official cash rate is expected to be cut.

title.children: Mortgage wars are heating up ahead of Reserve Bank meeting

image.altText: A sketch shows Casandra Ventura wiping tears from her eye while in a witness dock in a courtroom.

props.synopsis: Sean "Diddy" Combs's former partner tells a New York court how he would allegedly threaten to release sex tapes to humiliate her and ruin her career.

title.children: Cassie accuses Diddy of rape and sex tape threats at trial

props.synopsis: It's an exclusive tourist destination and one of the most pristine places on the planet. It's the last place you would expect to find birds with bellies so full of plastic that they crunch if you squeeze them.

title.children: On a pristine Australian island the birds are so full of plastic they crunch

image.altText: Two men wearing suits

props.synopsis: Russia has announced its delegation to discuss peace with Ukraine, with President Vladimir Putin's name notably absent.

title.children: Putin, Trump to skip Ukraine peace talks that Russian leader proposed

image.altText: Keir Starmer and Donald Trump shake hands and make eye contact

props.synopsis: The first trade deal struck following Donald Trump's tariff regime has drawn criticism from Beijing, which experts say is also a warning to other countries.

title.children: China sends 'loud and clear' warning over US-UK trade agreement

image.altText: A photo of a Chinese-Australian man Yang Hengjun, sitting on an outside table, wearing a navy polo shirt with a red collar.

props.synopsis: The Australian government continues to lobby for Dr Yang, who is imprisoned in China and has a cyst on one of his kidneys.

title.children: 'Tears blur my vision': Detained Yang thanks Australia as health declines

image.altText: A man looks at the camera with a blank expression.

props.synopsis: The family of Caleb List, feared killed fighting in Ukraine, says they are in shock and holding onto hope he is alive.

title.children: Australian feared dead in Ukraine 'always wanted to be a soldier', family says

image.altText: Nvidia logo and rising stock graph

props.synopsis: Technology companies led gains in US trade, with Nvidia, Tesla and Alphabet among the best performers. The ASX fell at the open after a mixed finish on Wall St. Follow live.

title.children: Tech stocks continue to gain but Wall St ends mixed

liveBlogKeyEvents.title: Mining, energy sectors lead ASX lower
New CEO for Treasury Wine Estates

image.altText: A newborn baby peeps over a woman's shoulder.

props.synopsis: In the largest study of its kind, researchers tested the vitamin D status of more than 70,000 people as babies.

title.children: New study reveals vitamin D deficient babies at higher risk of mental disorders

image.altText: a woman with grey hair smiling at the camera

props.synopsis: Patsy Bedford and hundreds of others across the Kimberley were not formally registered at birth, which authorities are now working to change later in life.

title.children: Patsy finally gets a birth certificate after 75 years of 'not existing'

image.altText: A man with dark hair wearing a suit and tie

props.synopsis: Former NSW Liberal MP Rory Amon, who has pleaded not guilty to sexually assaulting a 13-year-old boy, has been charged with breaching his bail conditions.

title.children: Former NSW MP accused of child sex offences charged with breaching bail

image.altText: A group of rangers and people in hi-vis stand among cars in a wooded area. Snow-topped mountains can be seen in the background

props.synopsis: A US rock climber survived 120-metre fall that killed his three companions and trekked more than 12 hours for help.

title.children: Climber treks 12 hours to payphone after deadly 120-metre fall

image.altText: Man with grey beard and hat (Craig Eury) holds up rock with fossil tracks in it.

props.synopsis: Fossil footprints found in Victoria by amateur palaeontologists have pushed back our understanding of when an early relative of most land-based creatures first evolved.

title.children: 'Surreal' fossil discovery pushes origin of reptiles back 40 million years

image.altText: A mechanic with a car.

props.synopsis: The Coalition's election pledge for nuclear reactors caused deep divisions within the community of Port Augusta — now that it's been taken off the agenda, locals are looking towards different futures.

title.children: Nuclear off the table in Port Augusta, as locals look in other directions

image.altText: A young girl in pigtails and denim overalls sits at a piano with sheet music. Her hands are on the keys as she reads the music.

props.synopsis: From when it was invented to how many keys it has — take our quiz and see how much you know about the humble piano.

title.children: How much do you know about the piano?

image.altText: Photo of artist Nara Walker standing close to a painting and looking at the camera. She has long brown hair and red lipstick

props.synopsis: Australian artist Nara Walker's name made international headlines after she was convicted for assault and imprisoned in a high-security Iceland jail. Now she's home, she explains how painting helped her endure the experience.

title.children: This Australian artist was imprisoned in Iceland. To endure it, she painted

image.altText: SG-1 Fathom autonomous glider single

props.synopsis: The drone was demonstrated at HM Naval Base Portsmouth over the weekend in front of the Royal Navy's fleet commander.

title.children: Australian underwater AI drones could soon bolster UK naval surveillance

image.altText: Critical mineral gallium turns to liquid at 30 degrees

props.synopsis: As the world faces an AI revolution, demand for gallium — used to make "lightning speed" computer chips — is expected to skyrocket.

title.children: Trade wars and AI drive demand for critical mineral unearthed in WA

image.altText: The cod glaring at the camera through the dirty glass.

props.synopsis: A routine survey confirms conservationists' hope that the apex predator will take care of its pest fish problems when big enough.

title.children: Critically-endangered Mary River cod found feasting on invasive tilapia

image.altText: David Mobbs and Kylie Truswell-Mobbs stand arm in arm with the ocean in the background.

props.synopsis: The son of a Queensland woman accused of murdering her terminally ill partner claims he confirmed with his father that he wanted to overdose, court documents show.

title.children: Woman tells investigators terminally ill partner allegedly 'begged her' to kill him, police affidavit reveals

image.altText: A person holds a phone showing an avatar on a map.

props.synopsis: New research shows nearly one in five young adults believe tracking a partner's location is to be expected in a relationship.

title.children: Tracking partner through apps 'problematic' as research finds link to coercive control

image.altText: Tottenham Hotspur's Dejan Kulusevski rolling on the ground, lying on the back of his head, legs in the air, after falling down

props.synopsis: Ange Postecoglou has been dealt a huge blow in his bid to steer Tottenham to the Europa League crown with star man Dejan Kulusevski ruled out of the final against Manchester United following surgery on his right knee.

title.children: Postecoglou's Spurs suffer major injury blow ahead of Europe League final

image.altText: Red wood ants dismembering a blue ground beetle

props.synopsis: Sydneysiders will have the chance to see 100 awe-inspiring shots in the annual tour of the Wildlife Photographer of the Year exhibition later this month at the Australian National Maritime Museum.

title.children: Bilby photo that took 'years' to snap among epic shots in Sydney exhibit

image.altText: Smiling bald man, wears pink, white striped shirt, has an ear speaker, a breathing tube over shoulder, phone strapped to hand.

props.synopsis: Modifications at school have helped David Deitz slip back into work, but he still cannot access many of the shops nearby. On Global Accessibility Awareness Day, he is urging businesses to do more.

title.children: Principal returns after cycling crash leaves him with quadriplegia

image.altText: A woman in a cap holds her hands out, filled with hazelnuts

props.synopsis: A family-run Tasmanian hazelnut farm that was reluctantly put up for sale last year has not only survived but thrived thanks to finding a market online.

title.children: Nut farmers crack business woes with online success

image.altText: Two women in white shirts smiling at each other in front of a beach

props.synopsis: Outdoor exercise groups surge in popularity as people look for low-intensity alternatives to keeping fit while staying social.

title.children: Low-intensity alternatives to run clubs gain popularity

image.altText: Lachie Schultz is helped by two trainers as he collapses

props.synopsis: The AFL is embroiled in a firestorm following the serious concussion sustained by Collingwood's Lachie Schultz, and the miscommunication that has followed.

title.children: How one concussion led to a saga forcing the AFL into a stunning backflip

image.altText: a group of First Nations models are dressed in Indigenous designed clothes smiling at the camera

props.synopsis: Backstage at Fashion Week, First Nations designers and models take a moment to reflect on the importance of representation.

title.children: ‘If you're Indigenous, you're beautiful’: Representation in fashion
